DOC.brief_summary: Patients suffer schizophrenia high risk become obese develop diabetes . Risk obesity particularly high new schizophrenia drug , clozapine olanzapine . These drug call atypical drug exert action part occupy receptor serotonin , particularly 5HT2A receptor subtype . This receptor may also interfere glucose metabolism insulin action . The purpose study compare atypical antipsychotic drug , olanzapine , act occupy 5HT2A receptor , another antipsychotic drug , amisulpride , mainly act dopamine pathway . DOC.brief_title: Effect Atypical Antipsychotic Drugs Olanzapine Amisulpride Glucose Metabolism
DOC.detailed_description: 10 male healthy volunteer recruit . After informed consent , admit study ward 10:00 p.m. prior study day keep fast next morning . At 8:00 a.m. receive study medication ( olanzapine , amisulpride placebo ) . Subsequently , measurement insulin sensitivity insulin secretion perform euglycemic hyperinsulinemic clamp technique follow hyperglycemic clamp .
DOC.criteria: healthy male volunteer write informed consent BMI > 30 kg/mÂ² Diabetes mellitus Hypertension Treatment drug interfere lipid glucose metabolism ( e.g . statin , oral antidiabetic drug , glucocorticoid ) History seizure
